text.p: Netscape Communications Corp's stock price fell sharply early Wednesday in a selloff sparked by a downgrade by Deutsche Morgan Grenfell, traders said.
They said analyst William Gurley cut his recommendation on Netscape to accumulate from buy. Gurley's office declined comment. The change was based on valuation, among other factors, traders said.

In morning Nasdaq trade, Netscape was off 8-1/4 to 50-1/2, a decline of 14.5 percent. Almost three million shares traded in the first 40 minutes of the Nasdaq session -- double the average daily volume in the stock.
A market maker in Netscape shares said Netscape closed yesterday at 58-3/8, near the analyst's price target of $60 per share.
In addition to valuation, the downgrade was also based on "a lengthening sales cycle, a new pricing model and a major product transition," the market maker said.
"But the fundamentals remain intact, though there is near-term uncertainty," he said.
The market maker quoted a DMG research note as saying, "The fourth quarter is on track, but we think there is little chance of significant upside."
